class_notes:
Baroque Art and Architecture, 1600-1750
From the streets of Rome to the halls of Versailles, secular and religious rulers across seventeenth-century Europe harnessed the persuasive power of art to project their authority over both crumbling and emerging nation-states. This course explores the profusion of the arts across Europe during political and religious crises, scientific discoveries, and intellectual developments that shaped the modern Western world.
course_description: The student will complete a specific individual project designed in consultation with a professor. This course does not satisfy distribution requirements in humanities.
